name: Light Switch 01
descriptions: Light Switch 01 is an artificial personality residing in the Sink in Big MT in the Fallout: New Vegas add-on Old World Blues.

Both of the Sink's light switches were originally created by Doctor Mobius as part of a project to research the ability of projected light to enhance a subject's cognition, with the results apparently being successful; Light Switch 01's light mode could increase a subject's intellect,

As with the rest of the Sink's appliances, the light switches were switched off when their personality modules were removed and thrown off the Sink's balcony by Doctor Klein, later being retrieved by Big MT staffers with Light Switch 01's ending up in the X-2 transmitter antenna array.
There was originally a dialogue option for Light Switch 01 where she acknowledges the Courier finding the "Smart Lights" upgrade before it is installed, but this was not included in the final game.
Light Switch 01 appears only in the Fallout: New Vegas add-on Old World Blues.
Travis Stout wrote Light Switch 01, in addition to all the other artificial personalities in the Sink.

PC The "Smart Light" and "Mood Light" bonuses are applied to the player only when the player enter dialogue with the light switch and toggle such light. So, after the light is toggled, when the bonuses passes, just re-entering the Sink and be exposed to the light won't be enough to get the bonuses again. In this case, to get again the bonuses of the light already toggled, it is needed to first toggle any other type of light (even normal light or lights off will work) and then toggle to the desired light again.

topics.response_text: I understand you're to be congratulated on the recovery of your missing organs. Bravo.

topics.topic_text: I found a holotape to upgrade you.
topics.response_text: You found my Smart Lights! Installing upgrade.
Doctor Mobius and I were{emphasis, innuendo}deeply involved in research on the ability of light levels to enhance human cognition.

topics.topic_text: I have to go. We'll talk later.
topics.response_text: Certainly. I'm looking forward to it.
We observed a fascinating phenomenon: certain spectra of visible light actually increased cognitive function and reasoning ability.

topics.topic_text: Is that anything like what the other light switch is working on?
topics.response_text: {sniff disdainfully}Hmph! I suppose if you want to conflate the betterment of man's mind with... with a luminous aphrodisiac.
I'm happy to answer what I can.

topics.topic_text: Can you turn those lights on for me?
topics.response_text: As much as I'd love to, I'm afraid not. The data from that study has gone missing. You'll have to find a backup if you want to use the Smart Lights.

topics.topic_text: It's not often I meet a light switch with brains and beauty. I think I'm going to like it here.
topics.response_text: {a little flustered}Oh... well, that's very sweet of you. Maybe one of these nights we can...{innuendo}discuss theorems?
{Flirty}Me too. Hope you can keep up - I work pretty fast. Here - something for you to brush up on.

topics.topic_text: Why wait? I can talk about theorems right now.
topics.response_text: {Still flirty, but playing hard to get}Slow down there, tiger - we've got all the time in the world. No need to rush into things.
{flustered, the player is playing hard to get and she's kind of into it}Don't keep me waiting too long, honey!
{Narration}{Lightwave Dynamics Lab discovered}One of them eventually transferred to the Lightwave Dynamics Plant - and began a long, unrequited affair with one of the holograms.

conversation.response_text: Adjusting lights for maximum concentration levels.
